title: Calories in Cocktail Sauce
meta_description: Discover calories in cocktail sauce per serving, including carbs, sodium, and full nutrition breakdown for this tangy condiment.
assumptions: Commercial cocktail sauce made with ketchup, horseradish, lemon juice, and Worcestershire; no added sugars or thickeners.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, recipe, ingredients, and portion size. Check labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: Cocktail sauce contains about 112 kcal per 100 g, mostly from carbs.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with product packaging.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil per 100 g for creaminess

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 tablespoon of cocktail sauce?
faqs.a: About 15-20 kcal per tablespoon (15 g), depending on the brand.

faqs.q: What makes cocktail sauce high in sodium?
faqs.a: Ingredients like ketchup and Worcestershire sauce contribute to around 1200 mg sodium per 100 g.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in cocktail sauce?
faqs.a: Yes, approximately 25 g carbs per 100 g, mainly from sugars in ketchup.

faqs.q: Is cocktail sauce low in fat?
faqs.a: Very lowâ€”only 0.5 g fat per 100 g, with minimal saturated fat.

faqs.q: How does cocktail sauce nutrition compare to ketchup?
faqs.a: Similar calories (around 112 vs. 100 per 100 g), but higher sodium and spice from horseradish.
